intro: Ottonia elocalis, commonly known as the narrowleaf ottonia, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Ottonia elocalis thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of understory vegetation in its native habitat.
